The beginning

I came in contact with Cefour AB in early 2013, if I don't missremember it made a fast journey from 0.10 SEK to 0.20 SEK and the stock seemed interesting. I invested purchased a bit for 0.18 and sold them again a day or two later for 0.23. I was super happy with my profit and had a nice feeling about Cefour. Their solution seemed scalable and they had a few contracts coming down the pipe so a week or so later when the stock came back down to 0.19 I invested again.

Note that Cefour has made a reversed split 50:1 in 2014 so 0.20 SEK is corresponding to 10 SEK. (For referrence last payed price 2016-08-15: 0.09 SEK down ~99% since my first entry)

The offer Acquisition

In the summer of 2013 the company made a few pressreleases about a croatian company that according to the releases where intressted of acquisitioning Cefour for about 0.40-0.45 SEK/share. Of course the price of the wen up and I felt like I made a great buy when I managed to get my hands on a few more shares for "only" 0.27 SEK.

It is still a bit unclear if there ever was a croatian company at all. What is 100% certain is that Cefour was never sold for 0.4 SEK. But a few of the more influential investors in Cefour did sell a large portion of their shares in connection with the pressreleases. When this became public knowledge the price of the stock droped like a stone all trade in the stock was suspended.

There was a period of chaos when the entire Board of directors was replaced and when the dust settled it turned out that Cefour was almost bankrupt.

Uphill from here?

My position in cefour was down 70-80% and they had to issue new shares to survive. I felt like I had two options participate and buy more shares or cut my losses. I decided two participate for three reasons.

  1. To my mind the beating the stock had taken due to the circus around the croatian company was a bit exessive.
  2. I did not like the idea of taking the loss. The amount of money it would have freed up was minor anyway.
  3. We have a concept in sweden called Investerar avdrag (link in swedish) which would give me tax benefits if I participated.

For the same resons I came to participate in another issue of new shares later in 2014.

Downhill it went

Needless to say if you look at a chart of the stockprice I was wrong. It went straight in the other direction, by now I have been following Cefour for three years now and I am not super optimistic about me making my money back.

You might ask why I would keep my shares given my opinion. The answer is simply: Tax reasons, one of the terms in the "Investeraravdrag" is that you should keep the shares purchesed in the emisson for at least 5 years or you have to repay the tax benefits you recieved. At the current price if I sold my shares I would end up owing the swedish government more in tax than I would recive from selling. So they stay in my account as a reminder of bad decisions I made when I was younger and more foolish (I hope).

This has hands down been my worst investment to date and the nice red number next to the value is -97.1% as I am writing this. But how fun would this be if you always where right? And I am happy I made this misstake at age 26 instead of 62 when i am about to retire. Of course there is no guarantee that I won't make the same misstake at age 62...

Sources

This piece is mainly written based on my memory of the events that transpired. I went back in my transaction history and the history of pressreleases at Avanza to verify a few things.
